greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, of coefficients for the third iteration of the hyperbinomial transform.
comment: Equals the matrix cube of A088956 when treated as a lower triangular matrix. The 3rd hyperbinomial transform of a sequence {b} is defined to be the sequence {d} given by d(n) = sum(k=0..n, T(n,k)*b(k)), where T(n,k) = 3*(n-k+3)^(n-k-1)*C(n,k). Given a table in which the n-th row is the n-th binomial transform of the first row, then the 3rd hyperbinomial transform of any diagonal results in the 3rd diagonal lower in the table.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
program: (PARI) for(n=0,10, for(k=0,n, print1(3*(n-k+3)^(n-k-1)*binomial(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 17 2017
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 05 2003
